summary: In 2016, we reported that Air Force combat aircrew training requirements—such as the flight and simulator hours required for proficiency—needed a comprehensive review of their effectiveness. Congress then required the Air Force to commission an independent study of training requirements and to report how it planned to respond to any report recommendations. The Air Force generally agreed with the study’s 9 recommendations on training but...
title: Ready Aircrew Program: Air Force Actions to Address Congressionally Mandated Study on Combat Aircrew Proficiency
